abstract.text: Make large-scale mathematical computations and image calculations, optimized for high performance and low energy consumption.
Implement and run neural networks for training and inference.
Manipulate large images using the CPU’s vector processor.
Perform basic arithmetic operations and common digital signal processing routines on large vectors.
Solve systems of equations where the coefficient matrix is sparse.
Perform common linear algebra operations with Apple’s implementation of the Basic Linear Algebra Subprograms (BLAS).
Perform computations on small vectors and matrices.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Training a Neural Network to Recognize Digits

abstract.text: Build a simple neural network and train it to recognize randomly generated numbers.
Compress a single file and store the result on the file system.
Recreate a single file from a compressed file.
Compress the contents of an entire directory and store the result on the file system.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Decompressing and Extracting an Archived Directory

abstract.text: Recreate an entire file system directory from an archive file.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Compressing and Saving a String to the File System

abstract.text: Compress the contents of a Unicode string and store the result on the file system.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Decompressing and Parsing an Archived String

abstract.text: Recreate a string from an archive file.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Compressing and Decompressing Data with Buffer Compression

abstract.text: Compress a string, write it to the file system, and decompress the same file using buffer compression.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Compressing and Decompressing Files with Stream Compression

abstract.text: Perform compression or the appropriate kind of decompression to a file based on its path extension.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Compressing and Decompressing Data with Input and Output Filters

abstract.text: Compress and decompress streamed or from-memory data, using input and output filters.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Compressing and Decompressing Files with Swift Stream Compression

abstract.text: Perform compression for all files and decompression for files with supported extension types.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Creating a Core Graphics Image Format

abstract.text: Provide descriptions of Core Graphics image formats for conversions to and from vImage.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Creating and Populating Buffers from Core Graphics Images

abstract.text: Initialize vImage buffers from Core Graphics images.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Creating a Core Graphics Image from a vImage Buffer

abstract.text: Create displayable representations of vImage buffers.
Resize an image with vImage.
Reflect, shear, rotate, and scale image buffers using vImage.
Combine two images by using alpha blending to create a single output.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Compositing Images with vImage Blend Modes

abstract.text: Combine two images by using blend modes to create a single output.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Applying vImage Operations to Regions of Interest

abstract.text: Limit the effect of vImage operations to rectangular regions of interest.
Improve your app's performance by converting image buffer formats from interleaved to planar.
Operate selectively on the elements of a vector at regular intervals.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Use Linear Interpolation to Construct New Data Points

abstract.text: Fill the gaps in arrays of numerical data using linear interpolation.
Increase the performance of common mathematical tasks with vDSP vector-vector and vector-scalar operations.
Reduce the sample rate of a signal, by specifying a decimation factor and applying a custom antialiasing filter.
Learn how vDSP packs frequency-domain data produced by Fourier transform routines.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Finding the Component Frequencies in a Composite Sine Wave

abstract.text: Use 1D fast Fourier transform to compute the frequency components of a signal.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Performing Fourier Transforms on Interleaved-Complex Data

abstract.text: Optimize discrete Fourier transform (DFT) performance with vDSP’s interleaved DFT routines.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Using Windowing with Discrete Fourier Transforms

abstract.text: Multiply signal data by window sequence values to reduce spectral leakage.
Use Accelerate’s discrete cosine transform to remove noise from a signal.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Performing Fourier Transforms on Multiple Signals

abstract.text: Use Accelerate’s multiple-signal fast Fourier transform (FFT) functions to transform multiple signals with a single function call.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Halftone Descreening with 2D Fast Fourier Transform

abstract.text: Reduce or remove periodic artifacts from images.
Transform vectors and matrices of temporal and spatial domain complex values to the frequency domain, and vice versa.
Transform vectors of temporal and spatial domain complex values to the frequency domain, and vice versa.
Transform vectors of temporal and spatial domain real values to the frequency domain, and vice versa.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Reading From and Writing to Core Video Pixel Buffers

abstract.text: Transfer image data between Core Video pixel buffers and vImage buffers to integrate vImage operations into a Core Image workflow

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Applying vImage Operations to Video Sample Buffers

abstract.text: Use vImage’s convert-any-to-any function to perform real-time image processing of video frames streamed from your device’s camera.
Use vImage to apply effects to a video feed in real time.
Pass image data between Core Video and vImage.
Use vectors to calculate geometric values, calculate dot products and cross products, and interpolate between values.
Solve simultaneous equations and transform points in space.
Rotate points around the surface of a sphere, and interpolate between them.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Rotating a Cube by Transforming Its Vertices

abstract.text: Rotate a cube through a series of keyframes using quaternion interpolation to transition between them.
Change the frequency response of an audio signal.
Apply biquadratic filters to single-channel and multichannel data.
Learn the fundamentals of the convert-any-to-any function by converting a CMYK image to an RGB image.
Convert a color image to grayscale using matrix multiplication.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Applying Color Transforms to Images with a Multidimensional Lookup Table

abstract.text: Create a multidimensional lookup table to convert RGB images to CMYK.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Standardizing Arbitrary Image Formats for Processing

abstract.text: Convert assets with disparate color spaces and bit depths to a standard working format for applying vImage operations.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Converting Luminance and Chrominance Planes to an ARGB Image

abstract.text: Create a displayable ARGB image from the luminance and chrominance information supplied by your device’s camera.
Convert an image to a different format.
Learn how vImage resamples image data during geometric operations.
Avoid ringing effects introduced by the default Lanczos algorithm when scaling an image by using a custom resampling filter.
Shear images horizontally and vertically.
Filter an image by convolving it with custom and high-speed kernels.
Simulate a bokeh effect by applying dilation.
Apply a convolution kernel to an image.
Dilate and erode images.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Adjusting the Brightness and Contrast of an Image

abstract.text: Use a gamma function to apply a linear or exponential curve.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Applying Tone Curve Adjustments to Images

abstract.text: Use the vImage library’s polynomial transform to apply tone curve adjustments to images.
Calculate the histogram of one image and apply it to a second image.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Enhancing Image Contrast with Histogram Manipulation

abstract.text: Enhance and adjust the contrast of an image with histogram equalization and contrast stretching.
Apply color transformations to images.
Calculate or manipulate an image's histogram.
Create sparse matrices for factorization and solving systems.
Use direct methods to solve systems of equations where the coefficient matrix is sparse.
Use iterative methods to solve systems of equations where the coefficient matrix is sparse.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Creating a Sparse Matrix from Coordinate Format Arrays

abstract.text: Use separate coordinate format arrays to create sparse matrices.
Perform computations on large vectors.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Solving Systems of Linear Equations with LAPACK

abstract.text: Select the optimal LAPACK routine to solve a system of linear equations.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Finding an Interpolating Polynomial Using the Vandermonde Method

abstract.text: Use LAPACK to solve a linear system and find an interpolating polynomial to construct new points between a series of known data points.
Approximate the definite integral of a function over a finite or infinite interval.

inlineContent.text: Accelerate provides high-performance, energy-efficient computation on the CPU by leveraging its vector-processing capability. The following Accelerate libraries abstract that capability so that code written for them executes appropriate instructions for the processor available at runtime:
Subroutines for constructing and running neural networks for both training and inference.
A wide range of image-processing functions, including Core Graphics and Core Video interoperation, format conversion, and image manipulation.
Digital signal processing functions, including 1D and 2D fast Fourier transforms, biquadratic filtering, vector and matrix arithmetic, convolution, and type conversion.
Functions for performing arithmetic and transcendental functions on vectors.
Libraries for performing linear algebra on sparse and dense matrices.
Although not part of the Accelerate framework, the following libraries are closely related:
A framework for performing multithreaded lossless compression of directories, files, and data.
Algorithms for lossless data compression that support LZFSE, LZ4, LZMA, and ZLIB algorithms.
A module for performing computations on small vectors and matrices.
